blog.name: hopelesstvaddict
blog.title: worry about the past. the future can wait.
blog.description:
No need to know the nAme. 
Swoon and marvel at simple things.
LOST defined life. Live in the Enchanted Forest. Love what happens in Westeros. Wish you could hang out in Rosewood with some pretty little liars. Agonize over the events in Beacon Hills. And so on. Unconditional Cut & Run, Titanic and LOTR lover. 
Proud Princess Aurora, Sansa Stark and Alison Dilaurentis supporter.

summary: Rewatching 'Baelor' I get a better understanding of Arya's resentment towards Sansa in Season 7. Arya escaped the castle when...
body:
Rewatching ‘Baelor’ I get a better understanding of Arya’s resentment towards Sansa in Season 7. Arya escaped the castle when the Lannisters slaughtered the Stark household but unlike Sansa, she had to live on the streets and thus never got a clear view of what happened. Sansa had the biased version of Cersei and the court while Arya probably got whatever twisted versions of the story the commoners told amongst themselves. I mean we all know how they blindly and stupidly absorb whatever tales they are told.

So what I’m saying is that Sansa had a slightly clearer version of what happened that led to her father’s imprisonment while Arya was left quite in the dark. And then Ned is dragged at the Sept of Baelor and Arya sees him for the first time and Sansa is here standing with the Lannisters. Arya cannot know what happened at court and she is unfortunately very young so it is easy to draw conclusions. And I know I was very harsh in Season 7 when it came to her accusations towards her sister but she actually didn’t really see Sansa plead for Ned’s life - she had already come down Baelor’s statue and amongst the shouts of the crowd, it probably was easy to not hear Sansa’s cries.

So yeah. Still not a fan of this S7 storyline but it was not THAT out of character as I thought it was

So what I’m saying is that Sansa had a slightly clearer version of what happened that led to her father’s imprisonment while Arya was left quite in the dark. blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

title: Aegon The Conqueror Come Again
description:
by TargaryenHassle

Ned Stark starts to notice the signs that the kingdoms may be plunged into darkness once again, he decides to tell the two outsiders of the pack, his twin “bastards” who they really are. With interesting reports coming from across the Narrow Sea, and Tywin Lannister being the hand of the king after Jon Arryn’s mysterious death and Ned’s refusal, he sees the need for new (well rather old blood) on the Iron Throne. Somebody who is honorable, and most of all somebody who actually cares about the people, not just their own personal gain.

And so begins the game of thrones.

Somewhat inspired by The Second Targaryen Dynasty by Targaryen92. I had this idea while reading this story, and I was unable to get it out of my mind. So thanks!

Words: 1429, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Game of Thrones (TV)
  • Rating: Explicit
  • Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence, Major Character Death, Underage
  • Categories: F/F, F/M, Multi
  • Characters: Jon Snow, Ned Stark, Lyanna Stark, Arthur Dayne, Howland Reed, Arya Stark, Catelyn Tully Stark, Daenerys Targaryen, Sansa Stark, Robb Stark, Rickon Stark, Bran Stark, Gerold Hightower, Oswell Whent, Viserys Targaryen, Illyrio Mopatis, Khal Drogo, Missandei (ASoIaF), Ghost (ASoIaF), Rhaegal (ASoIaF), Drogon (ASoIaF), Viserion (ASoIaF), Other Character Tags to Be Added
  • Relationships: Jon Snow/Daenerys Targaryen, Jon Snow/Arya Stark, Jon Snow/Arya Stark/Daenerys Targaryen, Catelyn Stark/Ned Stark, Robb Stark/Margaery Tyrell, Lyanna Mormont/Rickon Stark, Meera Reed/Bran Stark
  • Additional Tags: No White Walkers, at least right now we’ll see how this goes, robert is a whoremonger, Arthur Dayne lives, Oswell Whent Lives, Gerold Hightower - Freeform, Jon doesn’t go to the wall, Ned is a dumbass, jonrya, Jonerys, Aegon come again, Jon is a Targaryen, Arya is a Targeryen, Arya and Jon are twins, Sibling Incest, Aunt/Nephew Incest, they’re targaryen afterall, no Dany/Drogo because she doesn’t always have to be raped to be strong, maybe just needs the right people to push her in the right direction, Jon is not named Aegon, Arya’s real name is Visenya, tarlings., no wildlings for right now because they won’t try to come through unless i add white walkers later, Dark Jon Snow, Dark Arya stark, Dark Dany, at points, Other Additional Tags to Be Added

summary:
Jon: I'm worried about you and Arya, mate. 
Gendry: Why? Being with Arya is great. Will she kiss me? Kill me? Who knows!
Davos:...
body:
Jon: I’m worried about you and Arya, mate.

Gendry: Why? Being with Arya is great. Will she kiss me? Kill me? Who knows!

Davos: …that would worry most people, son.

summary:
Gendry: So ... it's been a while. What have you been up to?
Arya, shrugs: Oh, you know. Baking men into pies. Stealing their...
body:
Gendry: So … it’s been a while. What have you been up to?

Arya, shrugs: Oh, you know. Baking men into pies. Stealing their faces. The usual. What about you?

Gendry: Bashing in skulls with my warhammer and tracking down White Walkers.

Arya, smirks: That’s hot.

blog.description:
annalesa / 27 / pisces /
they would not make her yield
